alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia; Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Greene (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 3:23AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF EASTERN COLUMBIA...EASTERN GREENE...WESTERN COLUMBIA...WESTERN GREENE...AND EASTERN ULSTER COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a half of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 322 AM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from Coxsackie to 7 miles northwest of Athens to near Windham to Prattsville and moving east at 45 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Coxsackie and Kinderhook around 330 AM EST. Athens and Lorenz Park around 335 AM EST. Chatham and Hunter around 340 AM EST. Philmont around 345 AM EST. Austerlitz and North-South Lake Campground around 350 AM EST. Hudson around 355 AM EST. Claverack and Claverack-Red Mills around 400 AM EST. Catskill around 405 AM EST. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 21 and 21B. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia; Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Greene
